story.title: Beneath Your Mask - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: An anonymous admirer is texting Heather at a costume party‚Ä¶
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Chris Marie Green writes hot contemporary romance (like ‚ÄúBedroomies‚Äù!) plus urban fantasy. She also loves devouring pop culture and avoiding international incidents while traveling.

story.postPaywallNotification: Is Heather‚Äôs secret admirer the fox near the stairs? ü¶ä‚ù§Ô∏è Tap back into Hooked to find out!

messages.text: Did you choose that hot costume with me in mind?
Heather looks around the loud, chaotic costume party.
Who is this?
An admirer. And a big Avengers fan.
And you‚Äôre texting me HOW‚Ä¶?
When I saw you dressed as a female Captain America, I had to ask your friend for your number.
Queen Margaery?
That‚Äôs the one.
I might have to kill her, Game of Thrones style.
Don‚Äôt be too hard on her! She didn‚Äôt tell me your name.
But she did say you‚Äôd love the challenge of tracking down a masked admirer.
Was she wrong, Captain America üõ°?
A secret admirer hunt?
At the excited rush that floods her, Heather bites her lip and assigns this cocky guy a contact name‚Äî
My Ballsy Admirer.
She‚Äôs up for anything as long as she‚Äôs dressed in sexy costumes!
It just so happens that I‚Äôm bored, so okay. Let‚Äôs play.
Give me a hint about what you‚Äôre wearing.
Let‚Äôs just say your version of Captain-ette America does it for me‚Ä¶
But you‚Äôre still a universe away.
Are you dressed as an alien?
Um‚Ä¶NO.
Then you could be wearing almost any costume here!
Try harder.
üòõ
Could it be you‚Äôre the pirate standing by the door and texting?
Stop whiffing out, Cap. I know you‚Äôve got better aim than this.
Are you taunting me?
Maybe TEASING is a better word.
And if teasing gets you going as much as it does me‚Ä¶
Teasing is good. Keep it going, Mystery Man.
Then here‚Äôs another hint. My detective skills are pretty kick-ass.
Hmm. Maybe you‚Äôre the Sherlock Holmes standing by himself near the keg? And if you are‚Ä¶
Wait.
Please tell me you‚Äôre only *texting* me underneath that cloak.
LOL. Your friend did tell me you were saucy.
üòè
But you still haven‚Äôt confirmed that you‚Äôre not Self-Pleasuring Sherlock.
That‚Äôs an ALLEGED Self-Pleasuring Sherlock ‚Äî and it‚Äôs not me.
From here, I can‚Äôt tell WHAT he‚Äôs doing either üòÇ
LOL. At least now I know you‚Äôre in this room‚Ä¶
Not anymore.
You move fast, but I‚Äôm on your tail.
I‚Äôm going to the next room since you‚Äôre making me chase you through the house.
Perfect, because that leads to another hint‚Ä¶
I‚Äôm also hard to catch.
Heather exhales as her skin flushes and her pulse pumps.
This game has got her GOING.
Ah! You‚Äôre the wily fox near the stairs, aren‚Äôt you? I see you texting!
On second thought, foxes aren‚Äôt generally detectives, so never mind.
I will tell you this ‚Äî you‚Äôre getting hot if you‚Äôre near the stairs.
Then again, hot is how you started out‚Ä¶
I‚Äôve never seen Captain America with so many curves.
Such flattery. I‚Äôm almost thinking that my friend Jenna forced you to play this game.
Why would she do that?
I just got jilted. But that‚Äôs TMI.
Honestly, Jenna‚Äôs making a bigger deal of it than I am.
Heather swallows back the tightness in her throat.
Craving more distraction, she looks around for someone who‚Äôs texting and fits the clues.
To hell with the guy who did the jilting. Anyone who dropped you must be insane.
Keep up the sweet talk, Admirer. You just scored some major flattery points.
Scoring is the point of all this üéØ
My. You really are confident.
As a delicious shiver runs through Heather, her Queen Margaery matchmaking friend finds her.
Having fun yet?
Jenna, who is this guy? Please tell me he‚Äôs‚Ä¶
Ridiculously hot? Because he totally is.
You‚Äôre going to thank me for giving him your number.
YES!
I mean, whatever.
Yeah, whatever, Heather. You‚Äôre so into this.
A text makes Heather‚Äôs phone vibrate.
Asking your friend for clues is cheating.
I‚Äôm assuming you‚Äôre still in this room if you can see me talking to her.
I‚Äôm very good at blending. It‚Äôs part of my job.
Heather keeps looking around while talking to Jenna.
Jen, just give me a hint. Pretty please?
Okay. He‚Äôs somewhere within sight‚Ä¶unlike my own boyfriend.
You‚Äôd think it‚Äôd be easy to keep track of a Stormtrooper.
Forget Adam. Give me a better hint!
Excited much?
Hey, as long as this stays fun and I‚Äôm in costume‚Ä¶
At Heather‚Äôs lack of confidence, Jenna gives her a sympathetic look.
Heather shrugs it off.
Who wants to wallow in personal hang-ups when she‚Äôs got a good time waiting for her?
This is perfect, because I could use some fantasy before I have to go back to reality.
Mom wants me to come over for ‚Äúa special dinner‚Äù in a few nights.
Oh-oh. Is she preparing you for yet another one of her new, serious boyfriends?
Probably. Then again, who knows what the flightiest woman in existence wants to talk to me about this time?
Heather grabs Jenna‚Äôs arm as she spots a shadow moving into the hallway.
Did my admirer just leave the room?
Maybe.
You are THE WORST.
Jenna‚Äôs about to answer‚Ä¶but then she sees her Stormtrooper leaning against the wall and watching her.
Jeez, even when Adam‚Äôs got a helmet on, I can tell he‚Äôs got hearts in his eyes for you.
As Jenna waggles her eyebrows and leaves, Heather texts her admirer and heads for the hallway.
Can you see me now?
You‚Äôre always within my eyesight because I‚Äôm a guardian of the city. A protector in the night‚Ä¶
Oh DUH. You‚Äôre also a superhero, aren‚Äôt you?
If I am, you should count yourself lucky, Cap.
My people have a real rivalry with you Marvel characters. We don‚Äôt generally mingle.
OMG.
No matter which costume you‚Äôre wearing, YOU‚ÄôRE A NERD WHO LIKES DC COMICS!!!
Hey, who are you calling nerd? üòÇ
Please, non-nerds don‚Äôt care about the DC/Marvel rivalry!
Well, I did grow up reading DC‚Ä¶
I guess that makes me nerdy‚Ä¶but I‚Äôve never been called a nerd outright.
Heather is done looking in the hallway. No nerds or superheroes THERE.
I‚ÄôM a total nerd. It‚Äôs not a bad thing.
Damn straight it isn‚Äôt, especially if you‚Äôre a hot nerd like you.
Heather feels her heart swoon.
Where did you get your costume?
I cosplay most weekends, so I have a bunch of nerdy and elaborate outfits.
I like a woman who‚Äôs playful, whether it‚Äôs in costume or out of it.
Heather lets out a shaky, needful breath, then leans against a wall, scoping out the party.
She‚Äôs not about to let him know that she actually prefers to be IN costume.
So this is what I know about you so far‚Ä¶you‚Äôre a DC superhero with detecting skills‚Ä¶
And you‚Äôre super cocky.
Don‚Äôt you kind of have to be cocky to fight villains like we do?
No. I‚Äôm Captain-ette America, so I‚Äôm as humble as they come.
I‚Äôve been told that I make a lot of fangirls come.
Holy crap!
Now she HAS to find him.
She spots a tall Batman standing by the stairs and her pulse jerks, then starts beating madly.
Could this be her ballsy masked admirer‚Ä¶?
